articles.author: Shireen Khalil
articles.title: Donald Trump is a ‘gangster’
articles.description: THERE was a tense exchange between guests on the Q&A panel last night after one of them, radical Christian philosopher Cornel West, invoked fascist leaders Adolf Hitler and Benito Mussolini to criticise current US president Donald Trump.

articles.title: Prosecutors rest their case in trial of former Trump campaign chair Paul Manafort
articles.description: More than two dozen witnesses painted a picture of Manafort, 69, as a lavish spender with little regard for the law.

articles.title: Democrats look to longshot territory for midterm gains
articles.description: MASON, Ohio (AP) — As Aftab Pureval campaigns for Congress in southwest Ohio, he sometimes smilingly introduces himself as "a brown dude with a funny name." The Ohio native is the son of a Tibet-born mother and India-born father. He first upset the Cincinnati…

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S. rests its case against former Trump aide Manafort
articles.description: U.S. prosecutors on Monday rested their case against former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort after 10 days of testimony detailing how he avoided taxes on at least $16 million of income and lied to banks to maintain an extravagant lifestyle once his work …

articles.author: Jill Colvin
articles.title: Trump signs bill named for Sen. McCain, doesn't mention him
articles.description: President Donald Trump on Monday signed a $716 billion defence policy bill named for John McCain but included no mention in his remarks of the Republican senator, who is battling brain cancer at home in Arizona.

articles.description: Kathleen Folbigg, from New South Wales, Australia, was found guilty of killing her two sons and two daughters by suffocation between 1989 and 1999

articles.title: Yacimovich ‘not afraid’ after Broshi threatens lawsuit
articles.description: “His threats don’t scare me,” she said in an interview with the Mako news portal on Monday night. “My role as a public servant is to use the power I have to reach out to the weak...'

articles.title: Google-developed AI can read eye scans as well as humans
articles.description: A two-step analysis helps humans understand and trust the system’s recommendations.

articles.title: 'Catastrophe avoided': Seattle airport worker's plane heist risked hundreds of lives
articles.description: Richard Russell, 29, swiped an empty plane from Seattle-Tacoma International Airport on Friday and commenced a 75-minute flight complete with barrel roles and a darkly comedic, running commentary with air traffic controllers trying to talk him down.

articles.title: Florida man charged in parking lot death of black man following ‘stand your ground’ law controversy
articles.description: Prosecutors charged a white man with manslaughter Monday in the death of an unarmed black man whose video-recorded shooting in a store parking lot has revived debate over Florida’s “stand your ground” law.

articles.title: Morning mail: Turkey crisis, reef fund wrangle, Aretha Franklin ill

articles.title: Boy's remains found at New Mexico compound - CNN Video
articles.description: Five people have been arrested after 11 starving children were found living in squalor in New Mexico. CNN's Scott McLean reports.

articles.author: Emanuella Grinberg, CNN
articles.title: Imam says he helped lead police to New Mexico compound
articles.description: Imam Siraj Wahhaj said his daughter sent a plea for help via Facebook, which he passed to authorities, leading to the arrests of three of his children in New Mexico.

articles.title: Sheriff walks out of interview about compound - CNN Video
articles.description: The sheriff who investigated the New Mexico compound where 11 malnourished children were found walked out of an interview with CNN's Scott McLean.

articles.author: Scott McLean and Sara Weisfeldt, CNN
articles.title: Lawyers: No evidence children at New Mexico compound were training for school shootings
articles.description: Siraj Wahhaj's lawyer said he has seen no evidence supporting the allegation that children were being trained on a New Mexico compound to carry out school shootings.

articles.title: A four-year-old boy is still missing. Here's what we know about the adults who may have been the last to see him
articles.description: The case broke with a tip about starving children in a squalid New Mexico compound.

articles.title: UK will have 9 million more pensioners in 50 years, official figures show
articles.description: The UK will have 9million more pensioners within the next 50 years, official figures have shown.
